summary: I sometimes think that dany, jon, arya, and particularly bran are victims of the shows indifference to the growing magic plots...
question: I sometimes think that dany, jon, arya, and particularly bran are victims of the shows indifference to the growing magic plots of asoiaf, they took as much out as they could only to let the story feel hollow in the end.
answer:
I would have to agree; Sansa and Tyrion suffered in terms of characterization quite a bit, and their arcs went even further downhill when D&D ran out of the political nuance GRRM pulls off more successfully in the books, but their stories were generally removed from the magical aspects of the series. Arya’s arc was a mixture of misunderstanding character and disregarding magical importance, since her time at the House of Black and White had no effect other than the excuse “hm, she must have learned it there” when she pulled impractical and sudden stunts out of thin air.

Jon, Dany, and Bran’s arcs, on the other hand, absolutely required a deep understanding of the themes and narrative importance surrounding magic in ASOIAF. This is why their characters and their storylines became to jumbled and sloppy, and as soon as the Others became secondary enemies, they were doomed. Bran especially is rooted (heh) in the magic of the world, more-so than any other character. He’s also the character that was cut from an entire season, giving him the least amount of development and growth. If you want to know how invested the show writers were in the fantasy aspect of the series, look no further than what they did to him.

summary: I like how Bran was already looking at Sansa when the camera panned over to them at the dragon pit when everyone was Ayeing him...
body: I like how Bran was already looking at Sansa when the camera panned over to them at the dragon pit when everyone was Ayeing him as king. He knew what was probably on Sansa’s mind since she had been fighting for the North for so long, so he was curious about what she was going to say.

reblog.comment: I like how Bran was already looking at Sansa when the camera panned over to them at the dragon pit when everyone was Ayeing him as king. He knew what was probably on Sansa’s mind since she had been fighting for the North for so long, so he was curious about what she was going to say.

tags: A Song of Ice and Fire
summary: Chapter six is up! Only two more to go, things are getting exiting! I’ll say it once again, thank you so much for the support...
body:
Chapter six is up! Only two more to go, things are getting exiting! I’ll say it once again, thank you so much for the support you’ve all shown this story, whether you left a kudo or comment, it all makes my day just that much brighter!

Chapter summary:

Bran and Jon have made it to the cave of the Three Eyed Raven. Bran starts training with the Raven, leaving Jon to explore the tunnels under the weirwood tree.

summary: Rewatching GOT season 1 and if you had told me eight years ago that this cute little Bran was going to end up being King, I...
body:
Rewatching GOT season 1 and if you had told me eight years ago that this cute little Bran was going to end up being King, I would have been all for it! There was a point where I loved so many of these characters and were happy with how they were going that I would have been cool with any of them being King or Queen at the end.

Except Bran, this Bran we see at the start and who goes on his quest, is not the Bran who wins the throne. As Meera says, he dies in the cave with Summer and Hodor. An emotionless creature takes over his body and allows a city to burn to take control of the realm.

And Sansa - I don’t say much on Sansa and I suppose, being a Dany stan, people think I hate her. Far from it. I’ve adored watching Sansa grow and I wanted to see her be the one to bring down Cersei more so than Dany because Sansa had a history and relationship with Cersei that Dany didn’t. I wanted her to be the Queen ‘younger and prettier’ who takes the throne from Cersei LIKE THE SEVEN FACED GOD DAMN PROPHECY. I was cheering Sansa and Arya on when they fooled Littlefinger and when she fed Ramsey to his hounds. 

So why aren’t I happy that Sansa gets to be Queen of the North, which is actually just as large as the other kingdoms combined? Because, just like Bran’s rise to the throne and Dany’s fall to madness, it doesn’t feel earned. And that’s not to say we haven’t seen glimpses of Sansa being a good ruler and caring for her people - we have - but they were glimpses, always in the background, mostly used to points of arguments between her and Dany or her and Jon. Compare the three “King/Queen in the North!” scenes. For Robb and Jon, they were chosen by their people. They made no claim or push for royalty or independence - the North loved them and chose them. But with Sansa it felt like…she was basically Queen by default as there were no males left to content with her. We don’t see a single recognisable face at her coronation! We don’t see anyone CHOOSING her as the Queen apart from herself and her own brother (if he’s even still that) giving her the okay about it. Even the knight sworn to protect her has left her side! We don’t really see Sansa do anything this season that really showed her lessons and growth be for anything heroic - aside from giving the North independence. She’s mainly there as a rival for Dany, then not doing anything in the crypt - even at the Battle of Blackwater she was trying to keep everyones spirits up! - and then becoming an Oathbreaker and all her family leaving her again.

Tl;dr - Bran deserved better. Sansa deserved better. We deserved better.

summary: now that we know the siblings are going to separate at the end of the book series, there's something sweet about sansa and bran...
body: now that we know the siblings are going to separate at the end of the book series, there’s something sweet about sansa and bran being able to visit and write letters to each other. they were closer to each other than to others (the age difference between bran and the other boys was significant), they both enjoyed the same things, they both took after their mother’s culture more, they both understood the other more than anyone. idk i think it’s sweet.

reblog.comment: now that we know the siblings are going to separate at the end of the book series, there’s something sweet about sansa and bran being able to visit and write letters to each other. they were closer to each other than to others (the age difference between bran and the other boys was significant), they both enjoyed the same things, they both took after their mother’s culture more, they both understood the other more than anyone. idk i think it’s sweet.

summary: bran went through so much. his parents and siblings left him. he watched rodrik cassel and maester luwin, two men he has known...
body:
bran went through so much. his parents and siblings left him. he watched rodrik cassel and maester luwin, two men he has known his whole life, die. he was separated from his younger brother, never seeing him again. he made the choice twice not to contact his older brother so jon could stay at the wall, choosing to go to bloodraven with the reeds and hodor, only for jojen reed to die the moment he arrived. he began his training but after making a mistake his mentor never warned him about, the last of the children, bloodraven and hodor die in that cave. he met his undead uncle but they can’t stay together for long because benjen can’t cross the wall. then it was only meera and him but he needed to become the new three eyed raven to stop the night king so he uploaded all of humanity’s memories inside his head losing himself in the process. due to this meera reed leaves. as if that wasn’t enough, theon had to die to convince the night king that he was going to win so he wouldn’t see arya coming.

and the only person who really asked him to talk about this was tyrion lannister

summary:
Isaac’s last day on set.
«Isaac was an adorable little boy. The story really begins with you falling out of the tower window and...
body:
Isaac’s last day on set.

«Isaac was an adorable little boy. The story really begins with you falling out of the tower window and then you being crowned as the king. It’s been you the whole time. And we love you and thank you for coming on this bizarre journey with us.»

reblog.comment:
Isaac’s last day on set.

«Isaac was an adorable little boy. The story really begins with you falling out of the tower window and then you being crowned as the king. It’s been you the whole time. And we love you and thank you for coming on this bizarre journey with us.»

Isaac’s last day on set.

«Isaac was an adorable little boy. The story really begins with you falling out of the tower window and then you being crowned as the king. It’s been you the whole time. And we love you and thank you for coming on this bizarre journey with us.»

summary: “Catelyn was shaking. It was the grief, the cold, the howling of the dire wolves. Night after night, the howling and the cold...
body:
“Catelyn was shaking. It was the grief, the cold, the howling of the dire wolves. Night after night, the howling and the cold wind and the grey empty castle, on and on they went, never changing, and her boy lying there broken, the sweetest of her children, the gentlest, Bran who loved to laugh and climb and dreamt of knighthood, all gone now, she would never hear him laugh again. Sobbing, she pulled her hand free of his and covered her ears against those terrible howls. “Make them stop!” she cried. “I can’t stand it, make them stop, make them stop, kill them all if you must, just make them stop!”

George R R Martin, A Game of Thrones, Catelyn III

summary:
Robb’s voice softened. “He’s not going to die, Mother. Maester Luwin says the time of greatest danger has passed.” 
“And what if...
text:
Robb’s voice softened. “He’s not going to die, Mother. Maester Luwin says the time of greatest danger has passed.”
“And what if Maester Luwin is wrong? What if Bran needs me and I’m not here?”
“Rickon needs you,” Robb said sharply. “He’s only three, he doesn’t understand what’s happening. He thinks everyone has deserted him, so he follows me around all day, clutching my leg and crying. I don’t know what to do with him.” He paused a moment, chewing on his lower lip the way he’d done when he was little. “Mother, I need you too. I’m trying but I can’t…I can’t do it all by myself.” His voice broke with sudden emotion, and Catelyn remembered that he was only fourteen. She wanted to get up and go to him, but Bran was still holding her hand and she could not move.
source: George R R Martin, A Game of Thrones, Catelyn III

reblog.comment: George R R Martin, A Game of Thrones, Catelyn III
